name: vscode-statusbar-debugger
description: Adds a debugger to the statusbar, less intrusive than the default floating one

statusbarDebugger.template.description: Template used for rendering the statusbar item, by default a "bug" icon and the name of the current debug session

statusbarDebugger.command.description: Command to execute when clicking the "bug" icon. Possible values are: "start" always start the active configuration, "select" always ask to select the configuration, "auto" start debugging if it detects only one configuration and ask for a selection if there are more than one. If a debug session is active the command will always be to stop it

statusbarDebugger.activeColor.description: The color of the statusbar item when debugging

statusbarDebugger.alignment.description: Should the item be placed to the left or right?

statusbarDebugger.priority.description: The priority of this item. Higher value means the item should be shown more to the left
